item.title: Lenders ask RBI for tweaks to bond issuance plan

review.headline_rewrite: Lenders ask RBI for tweaks to bond issuance plan
bullets: Banks in a meeting with the RBI discussed an extension to the government’s second-half borrowing plan until mid-March, instead of traditionally ending in February,
The RBI typically releases the second half borrowing plan by end-September.
The slump also coincides with a global bond rout, fueled by worries of rising debt issuance and deteriorating fiscal discipline.
Under this method, all successful bidders receive bonds at a single price set by the RBI.
